details.description:
Shoreditch, London

£35,000 per annum


Applications for this role have now closed

The Open Data Institute connects, equips and inspires people around the world to innovate with data.

The ODI is working across the Data Spectrum with companies such as Deutsche Bank, Thomson Reuters and Arup to deliver open innovation.

About you

You’ll be an all-rounder who is comfortable doing a bit of everything on projects, from setting up spreadsheets and delivery plans to managing relationships with partners and delivering workshops overseas.

With a strong consulting or project management background, you will also be comfortable with Excel and project delivery models, and be very interested in working with public and private sector organisations. You will have grit and determination to get things done and want to work in a fast-growing small business.

You should feel comfortable working with and talking about data, both with public and private sector clients. You will enjoy helping other people to use data thoughtfully and in new and interesting ways.

You will have managed big (c£250k) projects before, and will know how to set them up well, keep them moving and report against milestones.

You will relish a challenge and respond calmly to moving parts, competing priorities and last-minute changes.

You will have:

  • Problem-solving and strategic planning ability analytical skills
  • Flexibility
  • The ability to cope with pressure and challenges
  • Commercial awareness and understanding of business environment
  • A passion for delivering outstanding work Responsibilities

Key responsibilities

You will:

  • Lead on projects, including set-up, delivery, evaluation and reporting
  • Work on multiple projects simultaneously, keeping track of priorities and client needs
  • Collaborate effectively across the organisation and with partners, associates and clients
  • Ensure projects and client work is clearly planned, complies with processes, and meets reporting needs
  • Deliver projects that might involve training, strategic advice or technical support for public or private sector organisations that want to innovate with data or use their data more effectively
  • Produce concise communications and other intellectual assets for a wide range of stakeholders

Skills and experience – essential

  • Insight and understanding of consulting organisations
  • Experience of managing projects within a consultancy, NGO or not for profit context
  • Educated to degree level, or equivalent professional experience
  • Experience of managing budgets and financial reporting of project milestones
  • An interest in open data
  • Strong IT skills
  • Fluency in English
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills

Skills and Experience – desirable

  • Experience of working with data or open data
  • Experience of web tools such as Google Suite docs/sheets/hangout/mail and Skype
  • Fluency in other languages
  • Experience working in a policy or strategic consultancy
  • Masters-level qualification, or equivalent professional experience
  • Experience working for a startup business

Applications for this role have now closed
